To find the least common multiple (LCM) of two numbers, we can use the relationship between the greatest common divisor (GCD) and the LCM. The formula is:

\[ \text{LCM}(a, b) = \frac{|a \times b|}{\text{GCD}(a, b)} \]

instruct_positive:
"The Great Wave off Kanagawa" is one finest works of Japanese artist Katsushika Hokusai. Painted in 1829, it is part of his series of 36 views of Japan, known as "Thirty-six Views of Mount Fuji". The painting depicts a massive wave towering over three boats, with the iconic Mount Fuji in the background. 

The composition is masterfully crafted, with the wave's crest reaching out to engulf the boats, creating a sense of chaos and danger. The wave itself is depicted with a dynamic, swirling motion, capturing the raw power and unpredictability of nature.
